ul_484961: for dir in */*; do
  if [[ -d "$dir" ]]; then
    ( 
      cd "$dir"
      mv -n * ..
      cd ..
      rmdir "$( basename "$dir" )"
    )
  fi
done

Explanations about Options.-maxdepth(C): finds all files ("-type f") that are at depth 1 ("-mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1") inside the sub-directories of "/root".
Explanations about Options.-maxdepth(M):
Descend at most levels (a non-negative integer) levels of directories below the
 starting-points. -maxdepth 0 means only apply the tests and actions to the
 starting-points themselves.
Explanations about Options.-mindepth(M):
Do not apply any tests or actions at levels less than levels (a non-negative
 integer). -mindepth 1 means process all files except the starting-points.
Explanations about Options.-name(M):
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.

so_42325576: find /root/* -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type f

find /root/12* ...

IFS=$'\n'
for i in $(find /root/* -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type f); do
    mv "$i" "${i%/*}/medium/"
done

ul_521808: rm -rf dirC; mkdir dirC
cp -p dirB/*.dm4 dirC/
cp -p dirA/*.dm4 dirC/
diff <(ls dirA) <(ls dirB)

$ cat << EOF > foo.sh; chmod 755 foo.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
rm -rf dirC; mkdir dirC
cp -p dirB/*.dm4 dirC/
cp -p dirA/*.dm4 dirC/
diff <(ls dirA) <(ls dirB)
EOF
